did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Harry J. Blacklidge papers, 1917-1947
did.abstract: The collection includes letters, work cards, two photographs, newspaper clippings, and various printed materials concerning the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners in America, Local No. 857; chiefly newspaper clippings concerning construction in the Tucson area, 1926-1927. Also includes papers relating to the formation of the apprenticeship training program in Arizona.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Harry J. Blacklidge papers (AZ 211). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harry Blacklidge was a carpenter. As a member of the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners in America, Local No. 857, he served as chairman of various committees.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into two series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes letters, work cards, two photographs, newspaper clippings, and various printed materials concerning the United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners in America, Local No. 857; chiefly newspaper clippings concerning construction in the Tucson area, 1926-1927. Also includes papers relating to the formation of the apprenticeship training program in Arizona.

item.corpname: United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Joiners of America. Local Union No. 857 (Tucson, Ariz.)

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Newspaper clippings and some photographs were removed and cataloged separately.

did.unittitle: Series I: Union Material, 1917-1941
Harry J. Blacklidge dues book. 1921-1924
Working cards from the Building Trades Department. 1918-1923
Working card from Local 857. 3rd quarter, 1925
Blacklidge's business cards. One lists contractor on the back.
Correspondence from Harold Hanover to Secretary Duffy regarding 40th Anniversary. May 28, 1941
Correspondence regarding 40th Anniversary. June 26, 1941
Correspondence regarding a banquet photograph which was going to be published in Carpenter. June 26, 1941
Correspondence from Frank Duffy promising to attend Labor Day. July 9, 1941
Correspondence regarding an account of Labor Day which was going to be published in the December issue of Carpenter. November 13, 1941
Photographs of Frank Duffy and Abe Muir.

scopecontent.p: Frank Duffy was a long time General Secretary of United Brotherhood of Carpenters and Builders of America. Abe Muir was a famed general organizer for the United Brotherhood.

did.unittitle: Copy of Carpenter, with a photo of the 40th Anniversary banquet. August 1941
Program of the 27th Convention at Prescott. September 18, 1938-September 20, 1938
Correspondence from Blacklidge, a plea for "buy at home." April 9, 1919
Article of erection of Red Cross Hut at the South Pacific Depot. ca. 1917
Scrapbook of Tucson construction. December 1926-August 1927
Loose leaf scrapbook of Tucson construction. August 1927-December 1927
Constitution and by-laws of the AFL-CIO merge State Federation. 1921-1924
Series II: Apprenticeship Training Material, 1947
File of materials documenting the beginning of the Apprenticeship Training Program. 1947
